reviewText: Elvira's Movie Macabre: Giant Monsters consists of four movies: Giant Gila Monster, Attack of the Giant Leeches, Monster From A Prehistoric Planet, and Teenagers From Outer Space. Elvira is good as always, but is this DVD set worth buying just for her? The short answer is "not really".Giant Gila Monster is a pretty bad movie about a giant lizard killing someone off every half hour. The only time this movie is even remotely entertaining is when the drunk redneck character is onscreen. 2 stars out of 5.Attack of the Giant Leeches is the worst of the lot. It is extremely poorly paced, with very little action. The leeches are hard to see, also. 1 star out of 5Things pick up a bit with Monster From A Prehistoric Planet. It's a Godzilla rip-off that actually has some good action scenes, but also a ton of boring talking scenes. 2 1/2 stars out of 5.The "best" movie on this set is Teenagers From Outer Space. It's a pretty campy sci-fi movie that I kinda liked. It's not great, but it's about as "good" as a movie included on Elvira's Movie Macabre can get. 3 stars out of 5.The problem I have with Elvira's Movie Macabre is that I like Elvira, but most of the movies she shows are godawful. The same can be said for Mystery Science Theater, but those guys had funnier quips and a lot more of them. Let's hope that Elvira has her own movie soon. I'm sure (like Elvira: Mistress Of The Dark and Elvira's Haunted Hills) that it will be way better than any of the movies included on this DVD.
summary: Elvira Is Good ; The Movies Are Not
Title: N/A

reviewText: Now as a die hard Elvira fan I expected to find the movies to be less then enjoyable and I was right. Please do not purchase this if you like good horror movies. If you enjoy crappy old horror movies then this is for you. Attack of the Giant Leeches is the only enjoyable movie on this set but Elvira's witty lines make up for it. Honestly do yourself favor and buy Elvira's Haunted Hills instead.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD is well worth the purchase price if you appreciate the wit and looks of Elvira.  She really rips on "Teenagers(?) From Outer Space" which itself is well worth the money spent as Elvira taps into her inner teen.  The 3 other flicks on this DVD are "Giant Gila Monster" with Elvira as pet sitter extraordinaire, "Attack of the Giant Leeches" with Elvira dealing with the IRS, & "Monster from a Prehistoric Planet" in which Elvira battles rip-off artist Elmyra. Highly recommended for Elvira fans!!

reviewText: This four monster movie set is wonderful. Elvira is very funny and adds fun to each film with her satirical comments and witty charm (and of course her beauty).A must for all sci-fi and Elvira fans!

reviewText: Elvira is really kicking it up a notch on these newer sets.  I was a bit cautious in trying this out since i would be double-dipping over the Mystery Science Theater 3000 versions.  I couldn't be happier with these.  Elvira has gotten more interactive with the films rather than only for "commercial breaks", popping-up during the film in the corner to poke fun at the film.  What she has added beyond that are larger skits and the mentioned interactivity.  One example is on Giant Gila Monster... she actually threw really funny subtitles over the foreign girl's speech.  The added touches make the films much more fun to watch.  I would describe in more detail, but would rather not spoil it.  There is an interesting bonus where she does a reverse cosplay of Hanna Minx off YouTube, spoofing her JWOW / "Minxy" video... since Hanna Minx had cosplayed Elvira, it was good for a giggle.  It is refreshing to see Elvira working hard to improve her presence on these shows as well as the internet.  These DVD's are fun and she spoofs them differently than Mystery Science Theater - Good Stuff!!!
